algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) with a bounded exploration area.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a path exists between source and target in a large grid with obstacles.
problem_summary_technical: Use BFS to check reachability from source to target and vice-versa, limiting search to a maximum area defined by blocked cells.
key_insights: The grid is too large for a standard BFS on the entire grid.
The key insight is that if the number of blocked cells is small (<= 200), they can only block a limited area.
If both source and target can reach a large enough area (more than what the blocks can enclose), they can reach each other.
